title: legend666
author: legend666
content: hello, somehow i lost my account from kraken.com but before i saved my key and my private secret key, is there any chance i could get the founds back?i am very new and i don't know much about cryptoplease help i would rly appericate it !

comments.author: Albad12
comments.body: As far as I know, Kraken is a CEX (centralized exchange), meaning you don't have control over your private keys, so I'm not exactly sure how you've managed to copy them. Are you sure you have the right keys ? Anyways recovering a crypto wallet while having the private keys is a relatively simple process, this guide should help you out:https://community.trustwallet.com/t/how-to-import-a-wallet-via-private-key/844

comments.author: legend666
comments.body: yes, when i created it, i saved them and i have the right one.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: legend666 on January 29, 2023, 11:25:42 PMhello, somehow i lost my account from kraken.com Is Kraken.com not a centralized exchange that provides custodial services for its users' wallets, where they do not have full control over their private key? I've never heard of a centralized exchange providing a private key for their wallets before.Quote from: legend666 on January 29, 2023, 11:35:01 PMyes, when i created it, i saved them and i have the right one.Are you sure about that? I don't know what you saved, but I doubt it's a private key.

comments.author: legend666
comments.body: sorry, I didnt mean that , i mean api key and api private key, can i recover my wallet from that? i have api key and api private key, is there anything i can do

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Quote from: legend666 on January 29, 2023, 11:25:42 PMhello, somehow i lost my account from kraken.com but before i saved my key and my private secret key, is there any chance i could get the founds back?i am very new and i don't know much about cryptoplease help i would rly appericate it !Maybe you have misunderstood, perhaps what you are referring here are account and password in Kraken and not the private key?Kraken is a crypto exchange and with that, exchanges, not only Kraken, but all crypto exchanges doesn't give their customers their private key. Or another scenario is that what you have is a private key but not in Kraken, maybe its a personal wallet, a non-custodial wallet like Electrum or Bitcoin Core.And please, if someone message or PM you and telling that they are willing to help but you have to give them your private key, don't. Because if you give them, then they have control of your private key then and if by chance you have something it it, they could steal it from you.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: legend666 on January 29, 2023, 11:51:01 PMsorry, I didnt mean that , i mean api key and api private key, can i recover my wallet from that? i have api key and api private key, is there anything i can doThe answer depends on the API Key permissions. Can you recall what permissions you set when generating the API keys?QuoteConfiguring an API KeyAPI keys have several settings and options that must be configured before the API key can be used, notably the name/description and access permissions.https://support.kraken.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000919966-How-to-create-an-API-key#2

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: If your account is verified and you're able to provide supporting information (they'll likely ask you to reverify and stuff), pretty sure you can. Start by writing to their support: https://support.kraken.com/hc/en-us/articles/215601908-Contacting-Kraken-SupportI'm guessing you don't have anything else like email address, 2fa access, etc.?
